attributes.description: It amazes me sometimes that one little thing that I go through everyday for the heck of it and to have a bit of fun can be made and created in so many countries just to get to my little tattered cover store. I researched comic books, which are of much importance to many. But seeing where it came from was crazy. But what I found even crazier was that almost all products came from this process. Thinking that a little rubber band could have been to Austria, China, then the USA never occurred to me, but now as I walk through a store I always think a little bit more about where things come from. Supply chain to me means that wherever things were originally created then joined with something else then packaged is the chain that holds down the demanding monster of the society. I think this because if not for every link on the chain that monster would not get what it wants it will be angry. That monster being mad is not good. that is why supply chain is so important, if not for all the different places the product goes the society would erupt in frustration. Created by Seamus
attributes.title: The web of supply to make Spider-Man books

attributes.description: Finally this is where I get my Spider-man comic books and read them
attributes.title: Tattered Cover book store

attributes.description: Dyes are made from heavy petroleum and are a major ingredient to ink.
attributes.title: Dyes

attributes.description: Linseed oil is taken from a flax plant and is a solid that needs to be boiled down. It is an ingredient for ink.
attributes.title: Linseed oil

attributes.description: Heavy petroleum is a crude oil made from fossils that are mined in Russia. This petroleum is an ingredient to make ink for the comic.
attributes.title: Heavy Petroleum

attributes.description: Paper is made from trees in Canada that are chopped down and processed in a factory. The paper creates the pages for the comic book.
attributes.title: Paper

attributes.description: Ink is made from many materials. Such as crude, soybean and linseed oil. It was made with many dyes, such as: blue, magenta, yellow, and black. The ink is what goes on the pages of the comic book.
attributes.title: Ink

attributes.description: This is the factory that creates the comic books, it gathers all the materials from around the world and turns it into a comic book.
attributes.title: Marvel factory

attributes.description: Soybean oil is taken from soybeans and is an ingredient to make ink.
attributes.title: Soybean oil to Ink

attributes.description: This is where the original copy is made and edited. It is flown to L.A. to make millions more copies in the Marvel factory.
attributes.title: Stan Lee/Marvels offices to Marvel factory
Marvel factory to Tattered Cover book store
